elements.title: Susan Catania
elements.contents: ... that Susan Catania (pictured) shocked male legislators by bringing her infant daughter to the floor of the Illinois House of Representatives and nursing her baby in the women's restroom?

elements.title: Allenby Formation
elements.contents: ... that the Allenby Formation has been called part of a "Great Canadian Lagerstätte"?

elements.title: Satrio
elements.contents: ... that Satrio used water buffaloes to vaccinate 240,000 people against smallpox?

elements.title: Cello Sonata
elements.contents: ... that the Cello Sonata by John Foulds features quarter tones in the second movement, but it is uncertain if he introduced them in the 1905 version or the 1927 revision?

elements.title: Isla Dewar
elements.contents: ... that Scottish novelist Isla Dewar said "if ... a thing is not worth doing then it's worth doing fabulously, amazingly, with grace, style and panache"?

elements.title: 17 People
elements.contents: ... that The West Wing episode "17 People" has an entire website created by a "superfan" with the sole purpose of explaining it?

elements.title: Bangalore Jayaram
elements.contents: ... that Indian cricketer Bangalore Jayaram's English styled Mashie Lodge, was named after his favourite golf club, the Mashie Niblick?

elements.title: Golf Club: Wasteland
elements.contents: ... that the developers of the video game Golf Club: Wasteland jokingly announced that they would only sell one copy at a price of $500 million?
